citeinfo.origin: Gerald A. Sanger, Northwest Fisheries Center, National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Seattle, Washington
citeinfo.title: A Preliminary Look at Marine Mammal-food Chain Relationships in Alaskan Waters

abstract.p:
This report
proposes simplified food chains for three of the four broad areas of marine waters surrounding Alaska;
allocates estimated total pinniped populations and biomass among the three areas; and,
relates in some detail the proposed food chain to Northern fur seals.
Because so little is known about the status and distribution of Cetaceans in Alaskan waters, they are not directly considered in this report,.

[Reference: Sanger, Gerald A. A Preliminary Look at Marine Mammal-food Chain Relationships in Alaskan Waters. Marine Mammal Division, Northwest Fisheries Center, National Marine Fisheries Service, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, 17 May 1974.] Reprint available at the NOAA Seattle NMML Library.

descript.purpose: A report of collected data on a preliminary look at Marine mammal-food chain relationships in Alaskan waters.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
